SubItem.caption: Clone this framework
SubItem.instruction: The easiest way to create a new framework is to clone an existing one. Specify a prefix for your new framework below and click Clone. Your new framework will then be saved and reopened so you may continue to work with it.

SubItem.caption: Clone this framework as an empty framework
SubItem.instruction: The easiest way to create a new framework is to clone an existing one. When a new empty framework is created by cloning, it is stripped of everything except the command definitions it contains. Most properties are reset to their ‘as shipped’ state. Specify a prefix for your new framework below and click Clone. Your new framework will then be saved and reopened so you may continue to work with it.

SubItem.caption: Set the generation prefix used by this framework
SubItem.instruction: You can set a prefix to be used to name objects you automatically generate within this framework. The current prefix is displayed below. Change it as you like and then click Apply.

SubItem.caption: Create a repository object tracking list
SubItem.instruction: Creates a dynamic list based on the generation prefix, to track the objects you create in this framework. Enter a name for your repository list below and click Create. After it has been created you will find the list in the LANSA Repository as a List, within the Organizers item. If you select it, then right mouse it and tick the Is Favorite option it will appear on your Favorites tab.

SubItem.caption: Add an Administration application
SubItem.instruction: If you intend to use the VLF users and authorities feature, or allow users to change their passwords or use RAMP-TS, then your framework should probably contain an Administration application. This application will contain server and user authority maintenance programs. Click Add to add an Administration application to this framework.

SubItem.caption: Add the RAMP tutorials application
SubItem.instruction: Use this option if you are about to do the RAMP tutorials. Click Add to add the RAMP tutorials application to this framework.

SubItem.caption: Set up a launch page and sign-in form
SubItem.instruction: All VLF-ONE applications must have a customized launch web page. Most applications also have customized sign-in header and trailer panels. Enter a prefix for these 3 custom components and click Create.

SubItem.caption: Create a framework access validator
SubItem.instruction: All VLF-ONE applications must have a customized component to validate user sign on attempts. This component executes on the web server and allows, or denies, access to your application. Enter a name for this component and click Create. You may need to check this component into your web server.

SubItem.caption: Create a left edge slide in panel
SubItem.instruction: Slide in panels slide in from the top, left, right or bottom edges of the browser window. They may also be docked in place by end users. Enter a name for your slide in panel and click Create.

SubItem.caption: Create a right edge slide in panel
SubItem.instruction: Slide in panels slide in from the top, left, right or bottom edges of the browser window. They may also be docked in place by end users. Enter a name for your slide in panel and click Create.

SubItem.caption: Create a top edge slide in panel
SubItem.instruction: Slide ins are panels that slide in from the top, left, right or bottom edges of the browser window. They may also be docked in place by end users. Enter a name for your slide in panel and click Create.

SubItem.caption: Create a bottom edge slide in panel
SubItem.instruction: Slide in panels slide in from the top, left, right or bottom edges of the browser window. They may also be docked in place by end users. Enter a name for your slide in panel and click Create.

SubItem.caption: Create an assistance panel
SubItem.instruction: Your application can contain an assistance panel launched from the information symbol on the title bar. This is typically the panel from where you direct your end users to help or assistance related to your application. Enter a name for your assistance panel component and click Create.

SubItem.caption: Create a settings panel
SubItem.instruction: Your application can contain a settings panel launched from the gear symbol on the title bar. This is typically the panel from which your application allows user to alter settings that control how your applications behaves. Enter a name for your settings panel component and click Create.

SubItem.caption: Create a background panel
SubItem.instruction: The background of your entire application can be customized. Typically this is done to include your corporate logo or appearance. Enter a name for your background panel component and click Create.

SubItem.caption: Create an IIP and a custom framework manager
SubItem.instruction: Most VLF-ONE applications contain a customizable IIP (Imbedded Interface Point) you can use to alter the framework's behavior. For example, to do something at framework startup you use your IIP's avMainWindowReady method. A custom framework manager allows you to easily share code and signal events between the parts of your application. Enter a prefix for these two components and click Create.

SubItem.caption: Add a log out command to the toolbar
SubItem.instruction: It is common to put a Log Out option on your application’s main tool bar. Enter a name for the program that will handle logging out of your application and click Create.

SubItem.caption: Add an "About" command to the toolbar
SubItem.instruction: It is common to put an "About" option on your application’s main tool bar to show build and version details and often copyrights. Enter a name for the program that will handle showing your applications about details and click Create.

SubItem.caption: Add a new command to the toolbar
SubItem.instruction: Add a command to your framework’s toolbar. Enter a unique name for your command handler program by changing the prefill value below. Then specify a short caption that describes what the command does, and choose whether it needs to display a user interface. In VLF terminology this means whether it is a visible or hidden command. Then click Create. After the program has been created and snapped into the framework you will need to customize the logic it contains.

SubItem.caption: Create an application dashboard
SubItem.instruction: Create and snap in the outline structure of an application dashboard command handler. It will be automatically started as your framework starts, and also accessible from a tool bar icon. Enter a unique name for the dashboard command handler by changing the prefill value below, then click Create. After the command handler outline program has been created and snapped into the framework you will need to customize the logic it contains to match your dashboard requirements.

SubItem.caption: Change Colors
Change Images
Change Captions
Export Framework Definition
Set the field prefix used by this framework
SubItem.instruction: This is the prefix that identifies a field in lansa code. Change it if it does not suit your language The current prefix is displayed below. Change it as you like and then click Apply.
